title: (x) new Entertainment Weekly display face - Cioroli (custom) {Justin}
content:
I’m trying to figure out what EW’s new face is that they’re using on covers and in the feature well. Someone in another thread said it was [Titling Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20080322030955/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=verity.search&font_categories_search=font_name_search&searchstr=titling+gothic&image.x=0&image.y=0), which is close, but there are some definite differences, “g” and “Q” being the most obvious. There’s some similarity to Helvetica Neue as well, but it’s not a perfect match either. I’m wondering if they had a custom face done. Thanks for any help.

 [‹ (x) Sort of scripty, sort of italic "Columbia lake" logo - Book Jacket {Lauri}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080322030955/http:/www.typophile.com/node/18842 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) God of War - Georgia (customised) {Tom C} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080322030955/http:/www.typophile.com/node/18268 "Go to next forum topic")
author: mleister

comments.content: Despite doing what [this post](http://web.archive.org/web/20080322030955/http:/typophile.com/node/18067) says, I’m having trouble posting an image of a recent cover, so here’s a link: [http://www.ew.com/ew/covergallery/0,12924,1024216,00.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20080322030955/http:/www.ew.com/ew/covergallery/0,12924,1024216,00.html "http://www.ew.com/ew/covergallery/0,12924,1024216,00.html")
go to photoshop and set it under 500x500 pixels at 72 dpi and Save for Web. Always works.

Looks a lot like [Vectora](http://web.archive.org/web/20080322030955/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=LH.121032.0.7&attributes.sampleSize=48&sampleText=SOPRANOS&sampleSize=48) too. Good possibility it is custom. We need a bigger scan.
The N is wrong and the rounds aren’t quite square enough. The tail of the Q appears to be straight.
its a custom sans redrawn from old reference from a Italian type specimin from the late 1800’s. its called Cioroli (sp?).
Thanks, everybody. I’ve been without internet access (horrors!) for the past few days. Thanks for figuring this out while I was gone.
